experiences.title: Graduate Student Assistant
experiences.company: University of Texas at Arlington | Maverick Activities Center
experiences.description: As a Graduate Student I supported the delivery of campus services by acting as a primary point of contact for students, staff, and administrators. I focused on understanding student needs, resolving service issues, and coordinating operational workflows to improve service reliability and experience. This role strengthened my skills in customer engagement, cross-functional coordination, and service optimization.
responsibilities: Served as a frontline point of contact for 100+ students per week, resolving inquiries and issues related to campus services and activities.
Coordinated schedules, resources, and on-site staff for multiple weekly programs, improving operational flow and reducing on-site issues during events.
Used scheduling and operations systems to track attendance and service usage, supporting more accurate staffing decisions and smoother daily operations.
Recognized with the Outstanding Student Employee Award for consistent customer focus, reliability, and operational excellence.

experiences.title: Product Owner
experiences.description: As a Product Owner, I partnered with business stakeholders, engineering, and QA teams to translate complex requirements into prioritized backlogs and reliable releases. I supported end-to-end delivery by refining user stories, facilitating Agile ceremonies, and coordinating releases across multiple institutions. My focus was on improving requirement clarity, delivery predictability, and feature adoption in a multi-stakeholder environment.
responsibilities: Owned Product Roadmap and Delivery for a platform used by 20,000+ users across 300+ institutions.
Reduced requirement ambiguity by ~25% through structured stakeholder workshops and clearer documentation.
Drove a 15% improvement in feature adoption by managing and refining 100+ user stories with strong acceptance criteria.
Improved team velocity by 12% and sustained 95% on-time delivery across 50+ Agile sprints.
Reduced deployment delays by 20% through improved requirement clarity and test readiness.
Built KPI dashboards using Jira, SQL, and Power BI to track adoption, engagement, and release performance.
Coordinated end-to-end releases and onboarding for new institutions, achieving a ~90% successful rollout rate.

experiences.title: System Analyst
experiences.description: As a System Analyst, I supported requirement gathering, functional documentation, and system validation for a multi-institution platform. I worked closely with stakeholders and engineering teams to translate business needs into system-level requirements and supported testing activities to ensure reliable feature delivery.
responsibilities: Gathered and documented business and system requirements, ensuring consistent stakeholder alignment.
Translated complex system behavior into clear functional documentation, reducing rework by 15%.
Supported testing and validation cycles, contributing to a 98% test pass rate prior to release.
Analyzed data workflows to identify gaps and improve operational efficiency across institutions.

experiences.title: Functional Testing Intern
experiences.description: As a Functional Testing Intern at Siemens, I supported quality assurance activities for enterprise software by executing functional and regression tests across core workflows. I worked closely with QA and engineering teams to validate system behavior, document defects, and ensure release readiness. This role strengthened my understanding of system reliability, quality standards, and end-to-end product workflows.
responsibilities: Executed 50+ functional and regression test cases, identifying critical defects and improving overall release quality by ~15%.
Performed end-to-end workflow testing and documented results, increasing test coverage accuracy by ~12%.
Assisted with test data preparation and environment setup, reducing testing delays by ~25% and supporting smoother test cycles.
